marklogic.body:
I feel like things have really cracked up. It's as though society declared war on youth, but especially youth of color, about 30 years ago, and we now have adults from that Era who've internalized that message and simply take it for granted, to the point where an unarmed 17 year old shot and killed in Cold blood is barely even a controversy, at least in many circles.
It seems kind of unreal to have to explain why this killing was wrong.
